name: py-dasbus

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
Dasbus is a DBus library written in Python 3, based on GLib and inspired
by pydbus.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-pygobject
dependencies.description: bindings for the GLib, and GObject, to be used in Python.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependent_to.name: geopm-service
dependent_to.description:
The Global Extensible Open Power Manager (GEOPM) is a framework for
exploring power and energy optimizations targeting heterogeneous
platforms. The GEOPM package provides many built-in features. A simple
use case is reading hardware counters and setting hardware controls with
platform independent syntax using a command line tool on a particular
compute node. An advanced use case is dynamically coordinating hardware
settings across all compute nodes used by a distributed application is
response to the application's behavior and requests from the resource
manager. Note: GEOPM interfaces with hardware using Model Specific
Registers (MSRs). For proper usage make sure MSRs are made available via
the msr or msr-safe kernel modules by your administrator.
